TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TaxonomyField extends Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFieldLookup

Docs.summary: Represents a taxonomy field.

remarks.para: The TaxonomyField class is a custom field class that inherits from the class. If you set the properties of the TaxonomyField class, call the method for changes to take effect in the database.
The class contains the field value for the TaxonomyField class.
Either the object or the object server controls can render a TaxonomyField object.

Public Overrides Property AllowMultipleValues As Boolean
public: virtual property bool AllowMultipleValues { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AllowMultipleValues : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether multiple objects can be used in the object.
Docs.value: true to specify that multiple Term objects can be used in the TaxonomyField, otherwise false.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Guid AnchorId { Guid get(); void set(Guid value); };
member this.AnchorId : Guid with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the GUID of the anchor object for a object.
Docs.value: The GUID of the anchor Term for a TaxonomyField object.

remarks.para: An anchor Term is the Term in the hierarchical that serves as the root node of the objects that are permissible for the current TaxonomyField object.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool CreateValuesInEditForm { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.CreateValuesInEditForm : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the new objects can be added to the while typing in the editor control.
Docs.value: true if new Term objects can be added to the TermSet while typing in the TaxonomyField editor control; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: If this property is true and the TermSet is open, then typing text in the taxonomy field editor control will display a Create New option in the Suggestions drop-down list if that Term does not already exist at the root level of the TermSet. Selecting the Create New option will create a new Term with that text as the default object.
This property does not apply to the the Enterprise Keywords TermSet, since it always allows new Term objects to be added by selecting Create New in the Suggestions drop-down list.

It is not possible to create Term objects that are created by using the Create New at an arbitrary position in the hierarchy of Term objects in the TermSet. All Term objects created with this option are created at the root level of the TermSet.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property DefaultValueTyped As Object
public: virtual property System::Object ^ DefaultValueTyped { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the default or the object.
Docs.value: A or object that represents the default value object.

remarks.para: If the DefaultValue property is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) or an empty string, this property returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

Otherwise, if the AllowMultipleValues property is true, this property returns aTaxonomyFieldValueCollection object with the value set to the DefaultValue property.If the AllowMultipleValues property is false, this property returns a TaxonomyFieldValueobject with the value set to the DefaultValue property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance object GetFieldValue(string value) cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetFieldValue (value As String) As Object

Docs.param: A formatted string containing identifier, label, and path information to convert into a or a object.
Docs.summary: Converts the specified string value into a or a object.
Docs.returns: A object or a object that represents the parameter.

remarks.para: The parameter string must be formatted as a series of one or more string tokens separated by the delimiter. Each token consists of an internal identifier, a label, and a path:. ID the internal identifier of the list item. LABEL is the default Label of the corresponding Term in the TermStore. is a string of GUIDs delimited by a pipe (|) character and Terminating in the GUID that identifies the Term: .
For example, represents a single value. The string represents three taxonomyfield values that can be parsed into a TaxonomyFieldValueCollection object.
The delimiters in the string representation are defined by the following properties: is returned by the property, and is returned by the property.

The property deTermines whether the object allows multiple values. If the TaxonomyField object does not allow multiple values, a object is returned. Otherwise a object is returned even if the parameter represents a single value.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetFieldValueAsHtml(object value) cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetFieldValueAsHtml (value As Object) As String

Docs.param: An object of type or that represents the value to convert.
Docs.summary: Returns the field value in HTML format in order to render the field valuedirectly on a page.
Docs.returns: A string that contains the value in HTML format.

remarks.para: If the property of the object is false, the parameter is expected to be of type or or have an accurate string representation returned by the ToString method.

If the property of the TaxonomyField object is true, the parameter is expected to be of type or or have an accurate string representation returned by the ToString method. The HTML returned by this method will contain each value in the collection separated by a semi-colon character.
If the parameter is a object or object, the returned string will be HTML encoded.
If the parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), an empty string is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string GetFilteringHtml (string filterValues, Microsoft.SharePoint.SPField field, string queryStr);
.method public static hidebysig string GetFilteringHtml(string filterValues, class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPField field, string queryStr) cil managed
Public Shared Function GetFilteringHtml (filterValues As String, field As SPField, queryStr As String) As String
public: static System::String ^ GetFilteringHtml(System::String ^ filterValues, Microsoft::SharePoint::SPField ^ field, System::String ^ queryStr);
static member GetFilteringHtml : string * Microsoft.SharePoint.SPField * string -> string

Docs.param: A string containing the default HTML that will be rendered by SharePoint Foundation if this method is unable construct a custom HTML string.
A TaxonomyField object that encapsulates the field to filter on.
The URL query string containing the GUID of the Term that is currently used as the filter and a flag indicating whether any of its descendants are to be included in the filter results.
Docs.summary: Constructs an HTML string that can be rendered to display a list of objects that can be used to filter on the specified object.
Docs.returns: An HTML string that can be rendered to display a list of Term objects that can be used to perform filtering on the specified TaxonomyField object.

remarks.para: If the parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) or empty, or the parameter is not of type TaxonomyField, or the TaxonomyField it encapsulates is an Enterprise Keywords field, the HTML string supplied bythe parameter is returned. Otherwise a custom HTML string is returned that can be used to render the filter values.

If the parameter contains both the key-value pairs matching "FilterField([0-9]+)=”" and “FilterData([0-9]+)= for the specified field, the value from the second pair is assumed to be of the form . If the first part is 1, then all descendants of the Term identified by GUID will be included in the filter results.

The constructed HTML string contains a single nested unordered list () that contains information about the filtering Term and the list item IDs of the filtered list items. Descendant Term objects will be included in the filtering if the parameter indicates as such.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsAnchorValid As Boolean
public: property bool IsAnchorValid { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a Boolean value that specifies whether the object identified by the T:Microsoft.SharePoint.Taxonomy.TaxonomyField.AnchorId property is valid.
Docs.value: true if the Term identified by the AnchorId property is valid; otherwise, false

remarks.para: This property always returns true if the TaxonomyField points to the Enterprise Keywords TermSet, or if the TaxonomyField points to the entire TermSet (i.e., if the AnchorId property returns ).

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsKeyword As Boolean
public: property bool IsKeyword { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the value points to the Enterprise Keywords object.
Docs.value: true if the TaxonomyField object points to the Enterprise Keywords TermSet; otherwise, false

remarks.para: The Enterprise Keywords TermSet is always open and cannot contain hierarchical taxonomies. A TaxonomyField object that points to the Enterprise Keywords TermSet allows multiple values by default.

When editing a TaxonomyField object with this property set to true, new Term objects can be added to the Enterprise Keywords TermSet by selecting Create New in the Suggestions drop-down window in the TaxonomyField editor control.
Since the TermSet doesn't support hierarchical taxonomies, the Term Picker dialog box cannot be launched to pick Term objects for a TaxonomyField that has this property set to true.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IsPathRendered { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.IsPathRendered : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the default objects of all the parent Term objects of a Term in the object will be rendered in addition to the default label of that Term.
Docs.value: true if the default labels of all the parent Term objects of a Term in the TaxonomyField will be rendered in addition to The default Label of that Term.

remarks.para: If this property is set to true, the TaxonomyField is rendered as a series of default labels separated by colon characters:
RootLabel:...:ParentLabel:Label
If this property is set to false, only the default Label of each Term is rendered.
If you set the IsPathRendered property you must call the Update method for changes to take effect in the database.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsTermSetValid As Boolean
public: property bool IsTermSetValid { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a Boolean value that specifies whether the object identified by the property exists and is available for tagging.
Docs.value: true if the TermSet identified by the TermSetId property exists and is available for tagging; otherwise, false

remarks.para: This property always returns true if the TermSetId property points to the Enterprise Keywords TermSet.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property JSLink As String
public: virtual property System::String ^ JSLink { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a string containing a list, delimited with the '|' character, of all Javascript files required for the client-side rendering of values.
Docs.value: To be added.

remarks.para: Script-on-demand files are individually suffixed with "(d)"
The JSLink property is not supported on Survey or Events lists. A SharePoint calendar is an Events list.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool Open { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.Open : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the object is linked to an open object or a closed TermSet.
Docs.value: true if the object is linked to an open TermSet; otherwise, false

remarks.para: A TermSet is open if new Term objects can be added to it. It is closed if new terms cannot be added to it.

If the user is the term store administrator, group manager, or a term set owner, users can always use the term store manager page to add new Term objects to a TermSet object regardless of whether the TermSet is open or closed.
If the TermSet is open, use the Add new term link in the Term picker dialog box in the Web tagging user interface to add new Term objects.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string RenderFieldValueAsJson(object value) cil managed
Public Overrides Function RenderFieldValueAsJson (value As Object) As String

Docs.param: To be added.
Docs.summary: Renders the field value as a serialized JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) string.
Docs.returns: The field value in a serialized JSON format of the form (for single-value fields): {"TermID": "guid", "Label": "label"}or (for multivalued fields): [{"TermID": "guid1", "Label": "label1"},{"TermID": "guid2", "Label": "label2"}, ...]

remarks.para: The client-side rendering (CSR) framework calls the TaxonomyField.RenderFieldValueAsJson(System.Object) method to get the field value as a JSON object that the framework can serialize and send to the client.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the GUID that identifies the hidden text field in an item.
Docs.value: A object that identifies the hidden text field in an item.

remarks.para: Every object contains a related hidden text field that contains a string representation of the taxonomy field value. The hidden text field is identifiedby the GUID returned by this property.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool UserCreated { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.UserCreated : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the object is linked to a customized object.
Docs.value: true if the TaxonomyField is linked to a customized TermSet; otherwise, false

remarks.para: A TermSet is customized if it was created with the Customize your TermSet option selected at the time the field was created.
Term objects in a customized TermSet are available to other users in the site collection, but they are not offered as suggestions in enterprise keywords columns.

MemberSignature.Value: public override object ValidateAndParseValue (Microsoft.SharePoint.SPListItem item, string value);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance object ValidateAndParseValue(class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPListItem item, string value) cil managed
Public Overrides Function ValidateAndParseValue (item As SPListItem, value As String) As Object
public: override System::Object ^ ValidateAndParseValue(Microsoft::SharePoint::SPListItem ^ item, System::String ^ value);

Docs.param: The item containing the TaxonomyField for which the value is to be updated.
The field value in the same format as the method (for single-value fields) or the method (for multi-value fields).
Docs.summary: Parses the field value and returns a validated object.
Docs.returns: A parsed and validated or object.

remarks.para: This method is called by the client-side rendering framework when a field value needs to be updated.

A TaxonomyField is unique because it requires its value to be set using TaxonomyField.SetFieldValue method, instead of the more direct way of setting SPListItem["fieldName"]=value. Since the caller has no knowledge of this requirement, this method automatically calls the TaxonomyField.SetFieldValue method. You need to be aware that this method does more than just validate and parse the field value, but only for TaxonomyField objects.
